decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The use hereby permitted shall be discontinued] and the land restored to its former condition on or before 13/03/15 in accordance with a scheme of work submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 2 - The proposed development shall be carried out in all respects in accordance with the proposals contained in the application and the plans submitted (Drawing Numbers CHB-01, CHB-02, CHB-03, CHB-09. CHB-10, Design and Access Statement, Trakway Systems Specification, Flood Risk Assessment received 22/10/13
Compound Plan, Compound Comparison, Photo x2 received 29/01/14.
Compound movement plan received 30/01/14.
  ) therewith and approved by the Local Planning Authority, or as shall have been otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the building is used.

Condition : 3 - No demolition or construction work to contruct the compound shall take place on the site except between the hours of 8:00am  to 6:00pm on Mondays to Friday and none shall take place on Weekends and Public Holidays without the prior agreement of the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 4 - Within three months of the expiry of this permission or the cessation of the development for which permission is hereby granted whichever is the sooner,  the site shall be cleared of all buildings, temporary road surfaces, plant, machinery and all other structures and materials connected with the temporary use and the land returned to its former condition. A scheme for restoration should be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. This should include details of ground compaction reparation and details of species/seed mix to be used in regressing the area. Following the respreading, tining and scarifying of soils, the land shall be prepared to a state suitable for seeding, by cultivation and final grading using appropriate machinery.

Condition : 5 - Any facilities above ground for the storage of oils, fuels or chemicals shall be sited on an impervious base and surrounded by impervious walls. The volume of the bunded compound shall be at least equivalent to the capacity of the tank plus 10%. All filling points, vents, gauges and sight glasses must be located within the bund. The drainage system of the bund shall be sealed with no discharge to any watercourse, land or underground strata. Associated pipe work must be located
above ground and protected from accidental damage. All filling points and tank overflow pipe outlets must be detailed to discharge into the bund. All works and facilities as referred to above shall be constructed and completed in accordance with plans submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 6 - There shall be no open storage of goods or materials, including plant,
machinery, waste and refuse materials, on any part of the application site except within those areas identified for such a purpose on the approved plans.
Condition : 7 - The gates to the development hereby approved shall open inwards only.

Condition : 8 - There shall be no burning of waste or other materials likely to result in smoke or other nuisance by atmospheric pollution within the curtilage of
the premises.
Condition : 9 - No loose materials such as sand or aggregates shall be stored on the site except within enclosed bays, as detailed on the approved plans

Condition : 10 - No hazardous substances [i.e. any substance present in the same or greater quantities as set out in Schedule 1 of the Notification of Installations Handling Hazardous Substances Regulations 1982 [1982 No.1357], or any subsequent amendment thereto] shall be stored or used on or brought onto the site without the prior written approval of the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 11 - Prior to being discharged into any watercourse, surface water sewer or
soakaway system, all surface water drainage from parking areas and
hardstandings shall be passed through oil interceptors/trapped gullies
installed in accordance with a scheme previously submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. Roof water shall not pass through an interceptor / gully.

Condition : 12 - Full details of the method of illumination of the external areas of the site shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before development is occupied and the lighting shall only be implemented wholly in accordance with the approved details and retained as such thereafter.
Condition : 13 - No deliveries shall be taken at or despatched from the site outside the hours of 6-8am nor at any time on Sundays, Bank or Public Holidays.
description: Siting of a temporary unit to be used as a site compound and welfare facility on the University of Westminister land to the North West side of Chiswick Bridge
